intro: Ficus caffra var. sambesiaca, commonly known as the African fig or sambesiaca fig, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elongated leaves that are typically arranged opposite each other on the stems. The plant produces small, clustered greenish-white flowers followed by edible fig-like fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal forests and savanna regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
